entity.name: Meet the Press
entity.description: For almost as long as there has been television, there's been "Meet the Press." The hourlong Sunday morning public affairs program has featured interviews with countless U.S. and world leaders, and has reviewed, analyzed and discussed the news of the week -- all while looking toward the week ahead.

entity.name: President Trump puts VP Pence in charge of US response to coronavirus
entity.description: Donald Trump said the risk to the US from the deadly coronavirus “remains very low” and that he has put Vice President Mike Pence in charge of the American response to the outbreak.

text: @MeetThePress In an admittedly incoherent stand-up at his NC rally, Trump said the #Coronavirus was the left's "new hoax" & that there were "15 people in this massive country" and because "we went early" there could have been "a lot more than that" & the country is "doing great" & is "unified" https://t.co/sHL5FnyaW4
